H0.text: Equilibrium is the state that does not exist during the irreversible expansion of a gas into a vacuum, where the external pressure is measurably less than the internal pressure of the gas.

H1.text: Balance is the state that does not exist when a gas expands into a vacuum because the external pressure is measurably less than the internal pressure of the gas, making the process irreversible.

H2.text: Liquid does not exist as a state during the irreversible expansion of a gas into a vacuum, where the external pressure is measurably less than the internal pressure of the gas.

H3.text: Composition is the state that does not exist during the irreversible expansion of a gas into a vacuum, where the external pressure is measurably less than the internal pressure of the gas.

A4.text: If it has been left undisturbed for an indefinitely long time, classical thermodynamics postulates that it is in a state in which no changes occur within it, and there are no flows within it.
